ChatGPT said:

Nice your code is already clean. Ill point out the main issues I see (some are real bugs), then give you direct fixes you can paste.

1) HeroSection: background performance + smoother parallax

Problem

Youre calling setMouse on every mousemove React re-renders the whole Hero section constantly (including <Canvas />), which can cause FPS drops.

Fix (best practice)

Use CSS variables instead of state (no React re-render). Also update vars with requestAnimationFrame.

Replace your mouse/parallax logic with this:

tsx
useEffect(() => {
  let raf = 0;

  const handleMouseMove = (e: MouseEvent) => {
    if (raf) return;

    raf = window.requestAnimationFrame(() => {
      raf = 0;

      const x = (e.clientX / window.innerWidth - 0.5) * 2; // -1..1
      const y = (e.clientY / window.innerHeight - 0.5) * 2; // -1..1

      const root = document.documentElement;
      root.style.setProperty("--mx", String(x));
      root.style.setProperty("--my", String(y));
    });
  };

  window.addEventListener("mousemove", handleMouseMove, { passive: true });
  return () => {
    window.removeEventListener("mousemove", handleMouseMove);
    if (raf) cancelAnimationFrame(raf);
  };
}, []);

Then change both background divs to use CSS transform like:

tsx
style={{
  backgroundImage: `url(${currentBg})`,
  transform: "translate(calc(var(--mx, 0) * 12px), calc(var(--my, 0) * 8px)) scale(1.04)",
}}

Result: parallax stays smooth, Canvas wont re-render from mouse movement.

2) HeroSection: button spam & timing race conditions

Problem

Youre using setTimeout chains. If user clicks fast or component unmounts, you can get:

  • state updates after unmount

  • multiple timeouts still running

Fix

Store timeouts in a ref + clear them on unmount.

Add:

tsx
const timersRef = React.useRef<number[]>([]);
const clearTimers = () => {
  timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
  timersRef.current = [];
};

useEffect(() => clearTimers, []);

Then whenever you set a timeout, push it:

tsx
const t1 = window.setTimeout(() => { ... }, 350);
timersRef.current.push(t1);

Same for inner timeout.

3) VideoSliderSection: your Tailwind classes will NOT work

Big issue

Classes like these are invalid in Tailwind:

  • md:w-215, md:h-120, w-65, h-85, h-90, md:w-170 etc.

Tailwind only supports values it knows (or arbitrary like w-[860px]).
So your expand animation might be doing nothing or behaving randomly.

Fix

Use arbitrary values:

tsx
expanded
  ? `md:w-[860px] md:h-[480px] w-[92%] h-[360px] duration-[${EXPAND_MS}ms]`
  : `md:w-[680px] md:h-[380px] w-[72%] h-[300px] duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms]`

And PreviewCard:

tsx
className="
  hidden md:block
  w-[260px] h-[340px]
  rounded-[28px] overflow-hidden
  shadow-[0_18px_45px_rgba(0,0,0,0.18)]
  opacity-90
"

Also your triangle play icon uses border-t-10 etc also invalid. Use:

tsx
<div className="ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[10px] border-b-[10px] border-l-[16px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/90" />

4) VideoSliderSection: IntersectionObserver effect dependency bug

Problem

Your effect depends on [phase], so it recreates the observer every phase change. Thats not needed and can cause weird behavior.

Fix

Make it run once:

tsx
useEffect(() => {
  const el = sectionRef.current;
  if (!el) return;

  const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => {
      const isInView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio > 0.4;

      if (isInView) {
        if (!hasStartedRef.current) {
          hasStartedRef.current = true;
          window.requestAnimationFrame(() => startSequence());
        }
      } else {
        stopSequence();
      }
    },
    { threshold: [0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1] },
  );

  obs.observe(el);
  return () => {
    obs.disconnect();
    clearTimers();
  };
  // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
}, []);

Result: stable observer.

5) Layout: body overflow-y-auto + h-screen sections

You have:

tsx
body ... min-h-screen overflow-x-hidden overflow-y-auto

This is okay, but note:

  • h-screen hero + overflow-y-auto on body sometimes causes mobile bounce/scroll issues.

If you see weird scroll on mobile Safari, change to:

tsx
<body className="... min-h-dvh overflow-x-hidden">

And in HeroSection use h-dvh instead of h-screen.

You said:
my current problem is i can scroll down to see video slider
ChatGPT said:

If you cant scroll down to reach the VideoSlider, 99% of the time its because some parent wrapper is locking the page height / overflow (not your HeroSection itself).

Here are the exact things to fix/check (in order)

1) Check your app/page.tsx (most common cause)

Make sure you are NOT doing something like:

  • className="h-screen overflow-hidden"

  • className="fixed inset-0"

  • a wrapper div that fills the screen and hides overflow

Use this structure:

tsx
import HeroSection from "@/components/hero-section";
import VideoSliderSection from "@/components/video-slider";

export default function Page() {
  return (
    <main className="min-h-dvh w-full">
      <HeroSection />
      <VideoSliderSection />
    </main>
  );
}

Important: dont put overflow-hidden on main / page wrapper.

2) Fix layout scroll properly (recommended)

Right now your body has overflow-y-auto. That can sometimes cause weird behavior depending on other wrappers.

Change layout.tsx body class to this:

tsx
<body
  className={`${geistSans.variable} ${geistMono.variable} ${aboreto.variable} antialiased min-h-dvh overflow-x-hidden`}
>
  {children}
</body>

So:

  • keep overflow-x-hidden

  • remove overflow-y-auto

Let the browser handle normal page scroll.

3) If you used a full-screen container anywhere, remove it

Search your code for any of these and remove/replace:

  • h-screen on the page wrapper (NOT inside Hero)

  • overflow-hidden on html, body, main, or root div

  • fixed inset-0 on a wrapper

Quick debug tip: open DevTools inspect <body> and <main>, and check computed styles for overflow: hidden.

4) (Optional) Better Hero height for mobile

On mobile, h-screen sometimes acts weird. You can switch to h-dvh:

tsx
<section className="relative w-full h-dvh overflow-hidden bg-black">

Fast question (no need to send lots)

Below is a complete, stable VideoSliderSection.tsx you can paste that matches your required behavior.

Drop-in VideoSliderSection.tsx (works like your spec)

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string; // /public/videos/x.mp4
  poster: string; // /public/video-thumbs/x.jpg
  title?: string;
};

type Phase = "idle" | "expanding" | "playing" | "ended" | "shrinking";

const EXPAND_MS = 650;
const SHRINK_MS = 450;

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      {
        id: "v1",
        src: "/videos/video-1.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg",
        title: "Forged Guardian",
      },
      {
        id: "v2",
        src: "/videos/video-2.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg",
        title: "Frost Sage",
      },
      {
        id: "v3",
        src: "/videos/video-3.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg",
        title: "Mystic Unicorn",
      },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [expanded, setExpanded] = useState(false);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");
  const [autoplayBlocked, setAutoplayBlocked] = useState(false);

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const centerVideoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  // avoid double-start in StrictMode
  const startedRef = useRef(false);

  // timers cleanup
  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;

  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pauseCenter = () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const playCenter = async () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    try {
      setAutoplayBlocked(false);
      v.currentTime = 0;
      v.muted = true; // autoplay friendly
      // important for some browsers
      v.playsInline = true;

      await v.play();
      setPhase("playing");
    } catch {
      // autoplay blocked (rare but happens)
      setAutoplayBlocked(true);
    }
  };

  const startSequence = () => {
    if (phase !== "idle") return;

    setPhase("expanding");
    setExpanded(true);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(() => {
      // after expand finishes, start video
      void playCenter();
    }, EXPAND_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const stopSequence = () => {
    clearTimers();
    pauseCenter();
    startedRef.current = false;
    setExpanded(false);
    setPhase("idle");
    setAutoplayBlocked(false);
  };

  // Start/stop based on viewport
  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.45;

        if (inView) {
          if (!startedRef.current) {
            startedRef.current = true;
            requestAnimationFrame(startSequence);
          }
        } else {
          stopSequence();
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.45, 0.7, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  const onEnded = () => {
    setPhase("ended");
  };

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    pauseCenter();
    setPhase("shrinking");
    setExpanded(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(() => {
      setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);

      // restart sequence for new center
      startedRef.current = false;
      setPhase("idle");

      requestAnimationFrame(() => {
        if (!startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          startSequence();
        }
      });
    }, SHRINK_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  return (
    <section ref={sectionRef} className="relative w-full py-24 md:py-28 bg-white">
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">
        <div className="mb-10">
          <h2 className="text-2xl md:text-3xl font-semibold text-neutral-900">
            Watch the Craft
          </h2>
          <p className="mt-2 text-neutral-500">
            Scroll here  the center video expands and plays.
          </p>
        </div>

        <div className="relative">
          <div className="flex items-center justify-center gap-6">
            <PreviewCard item={prev} />
            <CenterCard
              curr={curr}
              expanded={expanded}
              phase={phase}
              autoplayBlocked={autoplayBlocked}
              onEnded={onEnded}
              onNext={goNext}
              onManualPlay={() => void playCenter()}
              centerVideoRef={centerVideoRef}
            />
            <PreviewCard item={next} />
          </div>

          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -bottom-10 w-[70%] h-16 blur-2xl bg-black/20 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function CenterCard({
  curr,
  expanded,
  phase,
  autoplayBlocked,
  onEnded,
  onNext,
  onManualPlay,
  centerVideoRef,
}: {
  curr: VideoItem;
  expanded: boolean;
  phase: Phase;
  autoplayBlocked: boolean;
  onEnded: () => void;
  onNext: () => void;
  onManualPlay: () => void;
  centerVideoRef: React.MutableRefObject<HTMLVideoElement | null>;
}) {
  return (
    <div
      className={[
        "relative rounded-[28px] overflow-hidden",
        "shadow-[0_20px_60px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)]",
        "transition-all ease-out",
        expanded
          ? `md:w-[860px] md:h-[480px] w-[92%] h-[360px] duration-[${EXPAND_MS}ms]`
          : `md:w-[680px] md:h-[380px] w-[72%] h-[300px] duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms]`,
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <video
        key={curr.id}
        ref={centerVideoRef}
        src={curr.src}
        poster={curr.poster}
        preload="auto"
        playsInline
        muted
        controls={false}
        onEnded={onEnded}
        className="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover"
      />

      <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/35 via-black/0 to-black/0" />

      <div className="absolute left-6 bottom-5 text-white">
        <p className="text-sm opacity-80">Now playing</p>
        <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
      </div>

      {/* Autoplay blocked fallback */}
      {autoplayBlocked && phase === "playing" && (
        <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
          <button
            onClick={onManualPlay}
            className="rounded-full px-6 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
          >
            Tap to Play 
          </button>
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Next button after ending */}
      {phase === "ended" && (
        <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
          <button
            onClick={onNext}
            className="rounded-full px-6 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
          >
            Next 
          </button>
        </div>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}

function PreviewCard({ item }: { item: VideoItem }) {
  return (
    <div
      className="
        hidden md:block
        w-[260px] h-[340px]
        rounded-[28px] overflow-hidden
        shadow-[0_18px_45px_rgba(0,0,0,0.18)]
        opacity-90
      "
    >
      <div
        className="w-full h-full bg-cover bg-center"
        style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${item.poster})` }}
      >
        <div className="w-full h-full bg-black/20 flex items-center justify-center">
          <div className="w-14 h-14 rounded-full bg-white/70 backdrop-blur flex items-center justify-center">
            <div className="ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[10px] border-b-[10px] border-l-[16px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/90" />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

  • Videos should be H.264 MP4 for best browser support

VideoSliderSection.tsx (reference-style overlap + correct behavior)

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string;
  poster: string;
  title?: string;
};

type Phase = "idle" | "expanding" | "playing" | "ended" | "shrinking";

const EXPAND_MS = 650;
const SHRINK_MS = 450;

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      { id: "v1", src: "/videos/video-1.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg", title: "Forged Guardian" },
      { id: "v2", src: "/videos/video-2.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg", title: "Frost Sage" },
      { id: "v3", src: "/videos/video-3.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg", title: "Mystic Unicorn" },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [expanded, setExpanded] = useState(false);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");
  const [autoplayBlocked, setAutoplayBlocked] = useState(false);

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const centerVideoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  const startedRef = useRef(false);
  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;

  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pauseCenter = () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const playCenter = async () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    try {
      setAutoplayBlocked(false);
      v.currentTime = 0;
      v.muted = true; // autoplay friendly
      v.playsInline = true;
      await v.play();
      setPhase("playing");
    } catch {
      setAutoplayBlocked(true);
      setPhase("playing");
    }
  };

  const startSequence = () => {
    if (phase !== "idle") return;

    setPhase("expanding");
    setExpanded(true);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(() => void playCenter(), EXPAND_MS);
    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const stopSequence = () => {
    clearTimers();
    pauseCenter();
    startedRef.current = false;
    setExpanded(false);
    setPhase("idle");
    setAutoplayBlocked(false);
  };

  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.45;

        if (inView) {
          if (!startedRef.current) {
            startedRef.current = true;
            requestAnimationFrame(startSequence);
          }
        } else {
          stopSequence();
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.45, 0.7, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  const onEnded = () => setPhase("ended");

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    pauseCenter();
    setPhase("shrinking");
    setExpanded(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(() => {
      setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);

      startedRef.current = false;
      setPhase("idle");

      requestAnimationFrame(() => {
        if (!startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          startSequence();
        }
      });
    }, SHRINK_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  return (
    <section ref={sectionRef} className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden">
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">
        <div className="mb-12">
          <h2 className="text-2xl md:text-3xl font-semibold text-neutral-900">Watch the Craft</h2>
          <p className="mt-2 text-neutral-500">Scroll here  the center video expands and plays.</p>
        </div>

        {/* Overlap stage */}
        <div className="relative mx-auto h-[360px] md:h-[520px]">
          {/* LEFT (behind) */}
          <div className="absolute left-0 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-10 hidden md:block">
            <SideCard poster={prev.poster} />
          </div>

          {/* RIGHT (behind) */}
          <div className="absolute right-0 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-10 hidden md:block">
            <SideCard poster={next.poster} />
          </div>

          {/* CENTER (front) */}
          <div className="absolute left-1/2 top-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-20">
            <div
              className={[
                "relative overflow-hidden rounded-[34px]",
                "shadow-[0_30px_90px_rgba(0,0,0,0.28)]",
                "transition-all ease-out",
                expanded
                  ? `w-[92vw] max-w-[980px] h-[340px] md:w-[980px] md:h-[520px] duration-[${EXPAND_MS}ms]`
                  : `w-[86vw] max-w-[860px] h-[310px] md:w-[860px] md:h-[460px] duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms]`,
              ].join(" ")}
            >
              <video
                key={curr.id}
                ref={centerVideoRef}
                src={curr.src}
                poster={curr.poster}
                preload="auto"
                playsInline
                muted
                controls={false}
                onEnded={onEnded}
                className="absolute inset-0 h-full w-full object-cover"
              />

              {/* soft gradient like reference */}
              <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/30 via-black/0 to-black/0" />

              {/* Play icon (reference style) - show while not ended */}
              {phase !== "ended" && (
                <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center pointer-events-none">
                  <div className="h-20 w-20 rounded-full bg-white/20 backdrop-blur-sm flex items-center justify-center">
                    <div className="ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[14px] border-b-[14px] border-l-[22px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/70" />
                  </div>
                </div>
              )}

              {/* caption bottom-left */}
              <div className="absolute left-6 bottom-5 text-white">
                <p className="text-sm opacity-75">Now playing</p>
                <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
              </div>

              {/* autoplay blocked fallback */}
              {autoplayBlocked && (
                <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
                  <button
                    onClick={() => void playCenter()}
                    className="rounded-full px-6 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
                  >
                    Tap to Play 
                  </button>
                </div>
              )}

              {/* Next button after ending */}
              {phase === "ended" && (
                <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
                  <button
                    onClick={goNext}
                    className="rounded-full px-7 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
                  >
                    Next 
                  </button>
                </div>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* bottom shadow glow */}
          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 bottom-[-26px] w-[70%] h-16 blur-2xl bg-black/25 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function SideCard({ poster }: { poster: string }) {
  return (
    <div
      className="
        w-[360px] h-[320px]
        rounded-[34px] overflow-hidden
        shadow-[0_22px_70px_rgba(0,0,0,0.18)]
        opacity-95
      "
    >
      <div className="h-full w-full bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${poster})` }}>
        <div className="h-full w-full bg-black/10 flex items-center justify-center">
          <div className="h-16 w-16 rounded-full bg-white/15 backdrop-blur-sm flex items-center justify-center">
            <div className="ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[12px] border-b-[12px] border-l-[18px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/55" />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Why your old version didnt look like the reference

Because the reference uses absolute positioning + overlap layers, not a normal flex row. The code above matches that.

If you paste your NavBar code, Ill make sure it stays fixed/sticky like your screenshot and doesnt affect the overlap section spacing.

You said:
any reason why videos are lagging?
ChatGPT said:

Yes and with your setup, the lag usually comes from a few very specific things. Here are the real causes (most common first) + exact fixes.

1) Youre decoding/streaming huge MP4s (most common)

If the videos are 4K, high bitrate, or not optimized for web, browsers will stutterespecially during scaling/animation.

Fix

Export videos as:

  • H.264 MP4

  • 1080p (or even 720p for background/preview style)

  • Target bitrate ~ 610 Mbps (1080p), 35 Mbps (720p)

  • Keyframe interval around 2s

If you can, make a web-optimized copy.

2) Youre animating width/height (layout thrash)

When you animate w-[..] h-[..], the browser does expensive layout + repaint every frame. Thats a classic laggy expansion.

Best fix (smoothest)

Animate with transform: scale() instead of width/height.

Change center card to fixed size and only scale it:

tsx
<div
  className={[
    "relative rounded-[34px] overflow-hidden",
    "shadow-[0_30px_90px_rgba(0,0,0,0.28)]",
    "will-change-transform transition-transform ease-out",
    expanded ? `scale-[1.12] duration-[650ms]` : `scale-100 duration-[450ms]`,
    "w-[86vw] max-w-[860px] h-[310px] md:w-[860px] md:h-[460px]",
  ].join(" ")}
>

This alone often removes 80% of the lag.

3) Your video is being re-mounted every slide

Youre doing:

tsx
<video key={curr.id} ... />

That forces a full re-mount (re-decode, re-buffer) each time the active changes. Its okay, but can feel laggy.

Fix option A (keep re-mount, but preload next)

Preload next video in the background using hidden <video preload="auto" />.

Fix option B (no re-mount)

Remove key={curr.id} and instead update src manually:

tsx
useEffect(() => {
  const v = centerVideoRef.current;
  if (!v) return;
  v.src = curr.src;
  v.load();
}, [curr.src]);

Then play after load.

4) Use GPU hints (important)

Add these classes (cheap win):

  • On animated containers:

    • will-change-transform

    • translate-z-0 (or transform-gpu in Tailwind)

Example:

tsx
className="... will-change-transform transform-gpu"

5) Shadows + blur are expensive during animation

Your big drop shadows + blur glow look great, but when combined with size animation they can stutter.

Fix

Keep shadows, but avoid animating them. (Dont animate blur radius, dont change shadow during the expand)
Also consider reducing blur area:

tsx
<div className="... blur-xl bg-black/20" />

6) React Three Fiber Canvas is still running above?

If your <Canvas /> from Hero is still mounted and rendering at high FPS while you scroll, it can steal GPU time.

Fix

Pause rendering when Hero not in view (big win).
If you want, paste your ModelSlider code and Ill show you how to stop the render loop when the hero is offscreen.

Quick test to identify the real cause (fast)

Try these two changes first:

  1. Switch expand animation to scale() (transform-based)

  2. Add to the <video>:

tsx
playsInline
preload="metadata"

If it becomes smooth your main lag was layout + decode.

If you tell me:

  • video resolution (1080p? 4K?)

  • file size (MB)

  • codec (H.264? HEVC?)

Ill tell you exactly which optimization will help most.

You said:
need to make some changes to VideoSliderSection.tsx, when i scroll down from hero section the video gets bigger(tis should be full screen, after you click next it shrinks down and slides into next video and then it becomes full screen and start playing) and plays the video, after i click next, it changes to next video but it is not playing, If I scroll up and then down, Then it will work, And the animations look wired (not smooth) aslo add mute unmute button(mute on default)
ChatGPT said:

Got it. Youre hitting two separate issues:

  1. Next video not playing: after setActive, the <video> element changes, but youre not reliably triggering play() after the new video is ready. So it only works when you scroll (IntersectionObserver re-triggers).

  2. Weird / unsmooth animations: youre animating layout (width/height) + heavy shadows, which causes jank. Use transform-based animation (scale/translate) and a clean state machine.

Below is a rewritten VideoSliderSection.tsx that does exactly what you asked:

Behavior

  • Scroll down center video goes FULLSCREEN and starts playing

  • When video ends Next appears

  • Click Next video shrinks back into carousel, slides to next, then goes fullscreen and plays automatically

  • Mute/Unmute button (muted by default)

  • Smooth animations (transform-based)

Replace your VideoSliderSection.tsx with this

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";
import { Volume2, VolumeX } from "lucide-react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string;
  poster: string;
  title?: string;
};

type Phase =
  | "idle" // carousel visible, waiting
  | "fullscreen-enter" // animating to fullscreen
  | "playing" // fullscreen and playing
  | "ended" // fullscreen ended, show next
  | "fullscreen-exit" // shrinking back to carousel
  | "slide-to-next"; // carousel slides to next

const ENTER_MS = 650;
const EXIT_MS = 450;
const SLIDE_MS = 450;

// helper: play after the browser is ready
function playWhenReady(video: HTMLVideoElement): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    const tryPlay = async () => {
      try {
        // ensure a fresh start
        if (!Number.isNaN(video.duration)) video.currentTime = 0;
        await video.play();
        resolve();
      } catch {
        // autoplay could be blocked; still resolve (UI will show mute toggle)
        resolve();
      }
    };

    if (video.readyState >= 3) {
      void tryPlay();
      return;
    }

    const onCanPlay = () => {
      video.removeEventListener("canplay", onCanPlay);
      void tryPlay();
    };
    video.addEventListener("canplay", onCanPlay, { once: true });
    // kick load if needed
    video.load();
  });
}

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      { id: "v1", src: "/videos/video-1.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg", title: "Forged Guardian" },
      { id: "v2", src: "/videos/video-2.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg", title: "Frost Sage" },
      { id: "v3", src: "/videos/video-3.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg", title: "Mystic Unicorn" },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);

  // Center video element (always exists)
  const centerVideoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");

  // fullscreen mode (video covers viewport)
  const [fullscreen, setFullscreen] = useState(false);

  // mute control
  const [muted, setMuted] = useState(true);

  // slide track offset (carousel)
  const [slideOffset, setSlideOffset] = useState(0);

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;
  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pauseCenter = () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const enterFullscreenAndPlay = async () => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    // apply mute state to the element
    v.muted = muted;
    v.playsInline = true;

    setFullscreen(true);
    setPhase("fullscreen-enter");

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(async () => {
      await playWhenReady(v);
      setPhase("playing");
    }, ENTER_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const exitFullscreenToCarousel = () => {
    pauseCenter();
    setPhase("fullscreen-exit");
    setFullscreen(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(() => {
      setPhase("idle");
    }, EXIT_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  // Start when section enters viewport (only the first time; after that we control via Next)
  const startedRef = useRef(false);
  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.4;

        // only auto-start the very first time you reach this section
        if (inView && !startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          requestAnimationFrame(() => void enterFullscreenAndPlay());
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.4, 0.6, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, [muted]);

  // keep element in sync with state
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.muted = muted;
  }, [muted]);

  const onEnded = () => setPhase("ended");

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    // 1) exit fullscreen to carousel (shrink)
    exitFullscreenToCarousel();

    // 2) after shrink, slide carousel to next
    clearTimers();
    const t1 = window.setTimeout(() => {
      setPhase("slide-to-next");
      setSlideOffset((x) => x - 1);

      // 3) after slide, swap active and reset slide offset
      const t2 = window.setTimeout(() => {
        setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);
        setSlideOffset(0);

        // 4) immediately go fullscreen and play new video (NO scroll needed)
        requestAnimationFrame(() => void enterFullscreenAndPlay());
      }, SLIDE_MS);

      timersRef.current.push(t2);
    }, EXIT_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t1);
  };

  // IMPORTANT: whenever active changes, ensure the <video> is ready for play
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = centerVideoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    // when we change src via React, browsers sometimes keep old frame; load helps
    v.load();
  }, [curr.src]);

  return (
    <section ref={sectionRef} className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden">
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">
        <div className="mb-12">
          <h2 className="text-2xl md:text-3xl font-semibold text-neutral-900">Watch the Craft</h2>
          <p className="mt-2 text-neutral-500">
            Scroll down  it goes fullscreen, plays, then Next swaps videos.
          </p>
        </div>

        {/* CAROUSEL STAGE (behind / before fullscreen) */}
        <div className="relative mx-auto h-[340px] md:h-[460px]">
          {/* Track (smooth slide) */}
          <div
            className={[
              "absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center",
              "transition-transform ease-out",
              phase === "slide-to-next" ? `duration-[${SLIDE_MS}ms]` : "duration-0",
            ].join(" ")}
            style={{
              transform: `translateX(${slideOffset * 240}px)`,
            }}
          >
            {/* Left preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -mr-24 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={prev.poster} />
            </div>

            {/* Center card (normal size) */}
            <div className="z-20">
              <div className="relative w-[86vw] max-w-[860px] h-[310px] md:w-[860px] md:h-[460px] rounded-[34px] overflow-hidden shadow-[0_30px_90px_rgba(0,0,0,0.18)]">
                <div
                  className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center"
                  style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${curr.poster})` }}
                />
                <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black/10" />
                <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
                  <PlayIcon />
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Right preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -ml-24 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={next.poster} />
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* soft floor shadow */}
          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 bottom-[-22px] w-[70%] h-14 blur-2xl bg-black/20 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* FULLSCREEN PLAYER OVERLAY */}
      <div
        className={[
          "fixed inset-0 z-[80] bg-black",
          "transition-opacity ease-out",
          fullscreen ? `opacity-100 duration-[${ENTER_MS}ms]` : `opacity-0 pointer-events-none duration-[${EXIT_MS}ms]`,
        ].join(" ")}
      >
        {/* Video */}
        <div
          className={[
            "absolute inset-0",
            "will-change-transform transform-gpu",
            "transition-transform ease-out",
            fullscreen ? `scale-100 duration-[${ENTER_MS}ms]` : `scale-[0.88] duration-[${EXIT_MS}ms]`,
          ].join(" ")}
        >
          <video
            ref={centerVideoRef}
            key={curr.id} // keep key so it swaps cleanly per item
            src={curr.src}
            poster={curr.poster}
            preload="auto"
            playsInline
            muted={muted}
            controls={false}
            onEnded={onEnded}
            className="h-full w-full object-cover"
          />
          {/* subtle gradient */}
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/35 via-black/0 to-black/0" />
        </div>

        {/* Top controls */}
        <div className="absolute top-6 left-6 right-6 flex items-center justify-between">
          <div className="text-white">
            <p className="text-sm opacity-75">Now playing</p>
            <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
          </div>

          <button
            onClick={() => setMuted((m) => !m)}
            className="rounded-full px-4 py-2 bg-white/10 text-white hover:bg-white/15 transition backdrop-blur flex items-center gap-2"
            aria-label={muted ? "Unmute" : "Mute"}
          >
            {muted ? <VolumeX className="h-5 w-5" /> : <Volume2 className="h-5 w-5" />}
            <span className="text-sm">{muted ? "Muted" : "Sound"}</span>
          </button>
        </div>

        {/* Next button after ended */}
        {phase === "ended" && (
          <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center">
            <button
              onClick={goNext}
              className="rounded-full px-7 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
            >
              Next 
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function PreviewCard({ poster }: { poster: string }) {
  return (
    <div className="w-[360px] h-[320px] rounded-[34px] overflow-hidden shadow-[0_22px_70px_rgba(0,0,0,0.16)] opacity-95">
      <div className="h-full w-full bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${poster})` }}>
        <div className="h-full w-full bg-black/12 flex items-center justify-center">
          <PlayIcon small />
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

function PlayIcon({ small }: { small?: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div
      className={[
        "rounded-full backdrop-blur-sm flex items-center justify-center",
        small ? "h-14 w-14 bg-white/15" : "h-20 w-20 bg-white/18",
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <div
        className={[
          "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-transparent border-b-transparent",
          small
            ? "border-t-[11px] border-b-[11px] border-l-[18px] border-l-white/55"
            : "border-t-[14px] border-b-[14px] border-l-[22px] border-l-white/70",
        ].join(" ")}
        style={{
          borderTopStyle: "solid",
          borderBottomStyle: "solid",
          borderLeftStyle: "solid",
        }}
      />
    </div>
  );
}

Why this fixes your issues

Next video not playing

After active changes, we:

  • video.load() (forces browser to prepare new source)

  • go fullscreen and call playWhenReady(video) which waits for canplay if needed

So it plays without needing scroll.

Smooth animations

Fullscreen expansion/shrink uses transform + opacity (GPU friendly) instead of width/height.

Mute/unmute

Video is muted by default, button toggles muted and updates the element.

One more tip (video lag)

If your mp4 files are huge (4K / high bitrate), fullscreen playback may still stutter. If you tell me:

  • video resolution + file size
    Ill tell you the best export settings.

If you want, I can also add:

  • a progress bar

  • Replay button

  • click-to-toggle mute

  • click-to-pause/play in fullscreen

ChatGPT said:

So well do this:

  • When you enter the section center card expands to fill the stage (not the page).

  • Video plays.

  • When it ends Next appears.

Here is the updated component (no fixed fullscreen overlay).

VideoSliderSection.tsx (section-fullscreen stage)

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";
import { Volume2, VolumeX } from "lucide-react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string;
  poster: string;
  title?: string;
};

type Phase = "idle" | "expanding" | "playing" | "ended" | "shrinking" | "sliding";

const ENTER_MS = 650;
const SHRINK_MS = 450;
const SLIDE_MS = 450;

function playWhenReady(video: HTMLVideoElement): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    const tryPlay = async () => {
      try {
        video.currentTime = 0;
        await video.play();
      } catch {
        // autoplay can be blocked; ignore
      } finally {
        resolve();
      }
    };

    if (video.readyState >= 3) {
      void tryPlay();
      return;
    }

    const onCanPlay = () => void tryPlay();
    video.addEventListener("canplay", onCanPlay, { once: true });
    video.load();
  });
}

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      { id: "v1", src: "/videos/video-1.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg", title: "Forged Guardian" },
      { id: "v2", src: "/videos/video-2.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg", title: "Frost Sage" },
      { id: "v3", src: "/videos/video-3.mp4", poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg", title: "Mystic Unicorn" },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const videoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");

  // stage mode: when true, center fills the stage area
  const [stageFull, setStageFull] = useState(false);

  // slide offset for carousel motion
  const [slideOffset, setSlideOffset] = useState(0);

  // mute
  const [muted, setMuted] = useState(true);

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;
  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pause = () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const start = async () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    v.muted = muted;
    v.playsInline = true;

    setPhase("expanding");
    setStageFull(true);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(async () => {
      await playWhenReady(v);
      setPhase("playing");
    }, ENTER_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const onEnded = () => setPhase("ended");

  // auto-start first time you scroll into the section
  const startedRef = useRef(false);
  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.4;
        if (inView && !startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.4, 0.6, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, [muted]);

  // keep mute synced
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.muted = muted;
  }, [muted]);

  // important: after active changes, load new source so play works reliably
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.load();
  }, [curr.src]);

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    pause();

    // shrink back to carousel size (in stage)
    setPhase("shrinking");
    setStageFull(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t1 = window.setTimeout(() => {
      // slide carousel track
      setPhase("sliding");
      setSlideOffset(-1);

      const t2 = window.setTimeout(() => {
        // commit next video
        setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);
        setSlideOffset(0);
        setPhase("idle");

        // re-expand and play new video (no scroll needed)
        requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
      }, SLIDE_MS);

      timersRef.current.push(t2);
    }, SHRINK_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t1);
  };

  return (
    <section ref={sectionRef} className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden">
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">
        <div className="mb-12">
          <h2 className="text-2xl md:text-3xl font-semibold text-neutral-900">Watch the Craft</h2>
          <p className="mt-2 text-neutral-500">
            Center expands inside this section, plays, then Next swaps videos.
          </p>
        </div>

        {/* STAGE */}
        <div className="relative mx-auto h-[70vh] md:h-[78vh] min-h-[420px] max-h-[720px]">
          {/* Track (for slide effect) */}
          <div
            className={[
              "absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center",
              "transition-transform ease-out",
              phase === "sliding" ? `duration-[${SLIDE_MS}ms]` : "duration-0",
            ].join(" ")}
            style={{ transform: `translateX(${slideOffset * 220}px)` }}
          >
            {/* LEFT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -mr-24 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={prev.poster} />
            </div>

            {/* CENTER container */}
            <div className="z-20 relative">
              {/* Mute button (always visible on center) */}
              <div className="absolute right-4 top-4 z-30">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setMuted((m) => !m)}
                  className="rounded-full px-3 py-2 bg-black/35 text-white hover:bg-black/45 transition backdrop-blur flex items-center gap-2"
                  aria-label={muted ? "Unmute" : "Mute"}
                >
                  {muted ? <VolumeX className="h-5 w-5" /> : <Volume2 className="h-5 w-5" />}
                  <span className="text-sm">{muted ? "Muted" : "Sound"}</span>
                </button>
              </div>

              {/* The card itself */}
              <div
                className={[
                  "relative overflow-hidden rounded-[34px]",
                  "shadow-[0_30px_90px_rgba(0,0,0,0.22)]",
                  "will-change-transform transform-gpu",
                  "transition-transform ease-out",
                  stageFull
                    ? `duration-[${ENTER_MS}ms] scale-[1.14]`
                    : `duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms] scale-100`,
                  // base size (carousel size)
                  "w-[86vw] max-w-[860px] h-[310px] md:w-[860px] md:h-[460px]",
                ].join(" ")}
              >
                <video
                  ref={videoRef}
                  key={curr.id}
                  src={curr.src}
                  poster={curr.poster}
                  preload="auto"
                  playsInline
                  muted={muted}
                  controls={false}
                  onEnded={onEnded}
                  className="absolute inset-0 h-full w-full object-cover"
                />

                <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/35 via-black/0 to-black/0" />

                {/* Title */}
                <div className="absolute left-6 bottom-5 text-white z-20">
                  <p className="text-sm opacity-75">Now playing</p>
                  <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
                </div>

                {/* Play icon overlay while not ended */}
                {phase !== "ended" && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center pointer-events-none z-10">
                    <PlayIcon />
                  </div>
                )}

                {/* Next button after ended */}
                {phase === "ended" && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center z-30">
                    <button
                      onClick={goNext}
                      className="rounded-full px-7 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_12px_30px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
                    >
                      Next 
                    </button>
                  </div>
                )}
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* RIGHT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -ml-24 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={next.poster} />
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* floor shadow */}
          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 bottom-[-22px] w-[70%] h-14 blur-2xl bg-black/20 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function PreviewCard({ poster }: { poster: string }) {
  return (
    <div className="w-[360px] h-[320px] rounded-[34px] overflow-hidden shadow-[0_22px_70px_rgba(0,0,0,0.16)] opacity-95">
      <div className="h-full w-full bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${poster})` }}>
        <div className="h-full w-full bg-black/12 flex items-center justify-center">
          <PlayIcon small />
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

function PlayIcon({ small }: { small?: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div className={["rounded-full backdrop-blur-sm flex items-center justify-center", small ? "h-14 w-14 bg-white/15" : "h-20 w-20 bg-white/18"].join(" ")}>
      <div
        className={small ? "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[11px] border-b-[11px] border-l-[18px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/55"
                        : "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[14px] border-b-[14px] border-l-[22px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/70"}
      />
    </div>
  );
}

Why this matches what you meant

  • The fullscreen expansion happens inside the stage (section height), not a fixed overlay.

  • Next video auto plays after clicking Next (no scroll needed) because we load() + playWhenReady().

  • Animation is smoother because we animate transform scale (GPU) not width/height.

If you want the expanded state to truly fill the stage edge-to-edge (no scaling approximation), tell me your preferred stage padding (like px-6 or none) and Ill make the center card snap perfectly to stage bounds.

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";
import { Volume2, VolumeX } from "lucide-react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string;
  poster: string;
  title?: string;
};

type Phase = "idle" | "expanding" | "playing" | "ended" | "shrinking" | "sliding";

const ENTER_MS = 700;
const SHRINK_MS = 480;
const SLIDE_MS = 460;

/**
 * Ensures we attempt playback only after enough data is available.
 * This fixes the "next video doesn't play unless scroll" issue.
 */
function playWhenReady(video: HTMLVideoElement): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    const tryPlay = async () => {
      try {
        // restart
        video.currentTime = 0;
        await video.play();
      } catch {
        // autoplay might be blocked; that's okay (mute is default)
      } finally {
        resolve();
      }
    };

    if (video.readyState >= 3) {
      void tryPlay();
      return;
    }

    const onCanPlay = () => void tryPlay();
    video.addEventListener("canplay", onCanPlay, { once: true });
    video.load();
  });
}

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      {
        id: "v1",
        src: "/videos/video-1.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg",
        title: "Forged Guardian",
      },
      {
        id: "v2",
        src: "/videos/video-2.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg",
        title: "Frost Sage",
      },
      {
        id: "v3",
        src: "/videos/video-3.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg",
        title: "Mystic Unicorn",
      },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const videoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const startedRef = useRef(false);

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");

  // When true: the center card expands to "section-fullscreen"
  const [stageFull, setStageFull] = useState(false);

  // Slide motion for the carousel track (brief)
  const [slideOffset, setSlideOffset] = useState(0);

  // Audio
  const [muted, setMuted] = useState(true);

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;

  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pause = () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const start = async () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    v.playsInline = true;
    v.muted = muted;

    setPhase("expanding");
    setStageFull(true);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(async () => {
      await playWhenReady(v);
      setPhase("playing");
    }, ENTER_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const onEnded = () => setPhase("ended");

  // Auto-start only once when the section comes into view (first visit)
  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.42;
        if (inView && !startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.42, 0.6, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  // Keep mute synced to element
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.muted = muted;
  }, [muted]);

  // Ensure new src is loaded cleanly
  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.load();
  }, [curr.src]);

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    pause();

    // 1) Shrink back to carousel size
    setPhase("shrinking");
    setStageFull(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t1 = window.setTimeout(() => {
      // 2) Slide to next
      setPhase("sliding");
      setSlideOffset(-1);

      const t2 = window.setTimeout(() => {
        // 3) Commit next video + reset slide
        setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);
        setSlideOffset(0);
        setPhase("idle");

        // 4) Expand and play automatically (no scroll needed)
        requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
      }, SLIDE_MS);

      timersRef.current.push(t2);
    }, SHRINK_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t1);
  };

  // UI polish: hide the big play icon once we are actually playing
  const showPlayOverlay = phase !== "ended" && phase !== "playing";

  return (
    <section
      ref={sectionRef}
      className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden"
    >
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">
        {/* STAGE */}
        <div className="relative mx-auto h-[72vh] md:h-[80vh] min-h-[460px] max-h-[760px]">
          {/* Track (brief slide) */}
          <div
            className={[
              "absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center",
              "transition-transform ease-out will-change-transform transform-gpu",
              phase === "sliding" ? `duration-[${SLIDE_MS}ms]` : "duration-0",
            ].join(" ")}
            style={{
              transform: `translateX(${slideOffset * 240}px)`,
            }}
          >
            {/* LEFT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -mr-28 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={prev.poster} />
            </div>

            {/* CENTER */}
            <div className="z-20 relative">
              {/* Mute/Unmute */}
              <div className="absolute right-4 top-4 z-30">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setMuted((m) => !m)}
                  className="rounded-full px-3.5 py-2 bg-black/35 text-white hover:bg-black/50 transition backdrop-blur flex items-center gap-2 shadow-[0_10px_25px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)]"
                  aria-label={muted ? "Unmute" : "Mute"}
                >
                  {muted ? (
                    <VolumeX className="h-5 w-5" />
                  ) : (
                    <Volume2 className="h-5 w-5" />
                  )}
                  <span className="text-sm">{muted ? "Muted" : "Sound"}</span>
                </button>
              </div>

              {/* Main card (bigger as requested) */}
              <div
                className={[
                  "relative overflow-hidden rounded-[36px]",
                  "shadow-[0_32px_110px_rgba(0,0,0,0.22)]",
                  "will-change-transform transform-gpu",
                  "transition-transform ease-[cubic-bezier(.2,.8,.2,1)]",
                  stageFull
                    ? `duration-[${ENTER_MS}ms] scale-[1.18]`
                    : `duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms] scale-100`,
                  // Base size (larger)
                  "w-[90vw] max-w-[920px] h-[330px] md:w-[920px] md:h-[500px]",
                ].join(" ")}
              >
                <video
                  ref={videoRef}
                  key={curr.id}
                  src={curr.src}
                  poster={curr.poster}
                  preload="auto"
                  playsInline
                  muted={muted}
                  controls={false}
                  onEnded={onEnded}
                  className="absolute inset-0 h-full w-full object-cover"
                />

                {/* subtle cinematic gradient */}
                <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/40 via-black/0 to-black/0" />

                {/* Bottom-left label */}
                <div className="absolute left-6 bottom-5 text-white z-20">
                  <p className="text-sm opacity-75">Now playing</p>
                  <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
                </div>

                {/* Play overlay (not during playing / ended) */}
                {showPlayOverlay && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center pointer-events-none z-10">
                    <PlayIcon />
                  </div>
                )}

                {/* Next button after ended */}
                {phase === "ended" && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center z-30">
                    <button
                      onClick={goNext}
                      className="rounded-full px-7 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_14px_40px_rgba(0,0,0,0.28)] hover:bg-white transition backdrop-blur"
                    >
                      Next 
                    </button>
                  </div>
                )}
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* RIGHT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -ml-28 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={next.poster} />
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* floor shadow */}
          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 bottom-[-22px] w-[70%] h-14 blur-2xl bg-black/20 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function PreviewCard({ poster }: { poster: string }) {
  return (
    <div className="w-[360px] h-[320px] rounded-[36px] overflow-hidden shadow-[0_22px_80px_rgba(0,0,0,0.16)] opacity-95">
      <div
        className="h-full w-full bg-cover bg-center"
        style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${poster})` }}
      >
        <div className="h-full w-full bg-black/12 flex items-center justify-center">
          <PlayIcon small />
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

function PlayIcon({ small }: { small?: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div
      className={[
        "rounded-full backdrop-blur-sm flex items-center justify-center",
        "shadow-[0_18px_50px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)]",
        small ? "h-14 w-14 bg-white/14" : "h-20 w-20 bg-white/18",
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <div
        className={
          small
            ? "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[11px] border-b-[11px] border-l-[18px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/55"
            : "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[14px] border-b-[14px] border-l-[22px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/70"
        }
      />

  );

You said:
when scroll down from i need to mak eit like when i scroll down a little it should auto lock to next section
ChatGPT said:

Yep you want a scroll lock / snap effect: when the user scrolls a little after the Hero, the page should automatically snap to the next section (your VideoSlider section).

The clean, modern way is CSS Scroll Snap (smooth + reliable + no buggy wheel listeners).

Step 1: Update page.tsx to use scroll snapping

Replace your Home() return with this:

tsx
import NavBar from "@/components/ui/NavBar";
import HeroSection from "@/components/ui/hero-section";
import VideoSliderSection from "@/components/ui/VideoSliderSection";

export default function Home() {
  return (
    <main
      className="
        relative w-full h-dvh overflow-y-auto overflow-x-hidden
        snap-y snap-mandatory scroll-smooth
      "
    >
      <NavBar />

      {/* Section 1 */}
      <section className="snap-start h-dvh">
        <HeroSection />
      </section>

      {/* Section 2 */}
      <section className="snap-start min-h-dvh">
        <VideoSliderSection />
      </section>
    </main>
  );
}

What this gives you

  • User scrolls a little browser auto-snaps to the next section

  • Smooth lock-in feel (like Apple-style sections)

  • No extra JS needed

Step 2: Make sure Hero section uses h-dvh (important)

In HeroSection.tsx, change:

tsx
<section className="relative w-full h-screen overflow-hidden bg-black">

to:

tsx
<section className="relative w-full h-dvh overflow-hidden bg-black">

This makes snapping accurate on mobile too.

Step 3 (optional but recommended): avoid stuck snapping on small content

If a section is shorter than viewport, snapping can feel odd. Your Video section is already tall, so youre fine. If needed, keep it min-h-dvh (already done).

If you want an even stronger lock

Add this to the scroll container (the <main>):

tsx
snap-stop always

So:

tsx
className="... snap-y snap-mandatory snap-stop-always scroll-smooth"

(Some browsers support it; harmless if not.)

Quick note about NavBar

If your NavBar is position: fixed, snapping still works fine.
If its not fixed and you want it always visible, set it to fixed top-0 left-0 w-full z-50.

If you paste your NavBar code, I can adjust it so it doesnt cover the top of the snapped sections (common issue).

Note: I replaced backdrop-blur-x2 (not a standard Tailwind class) with backdrop-blur-md and added a subtle bg-black/10 for a premium glass effect.

2) Update your page.tsx to hide NavBar when Hero is not visible

This uses an IntersectionObserver on the Hero wrapper.

tsx
"use client";

import { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react";
import NavBar from "@/components/ui/NavBar";
import HeroSection from "@/components/ui/hero-section";
import VideoSliderSection from "@/components/ui/VideoSliderSection";

export default function Home() {
  const heroRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const [hideNav, setHideNav] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() => {
    const el = heroRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        // Hide navbar once hero is less visible (tweak 0.65 if needed)
        setHideNav(!(entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio > 0.65));
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.35, 0.65, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => obs.disconnect();
  }, []);

  return (
    <main
      className="
        relative w-full h-dvh overflow-y-auto overflow-x-hidden
        snap-y snap-mandatory scroll-smooth
      "
    >
      <NavBar hidden={hideNav} />

      {/* HERO */}
      <section ref={heroRef} className="snap-start h-dvh">
        <HeroSection />
      </section>

      {/* VIDEO */}
      <section className="snap-start min-h-dvh">
        <VideoSliderSection />
      </section>
    </main>
  );
}

What you get

  • NavBar is visible on Hero

  • As you scroll down, it smoothly fades + slides up (industry style)

  • It becomes unclickable when hidden

  • Scroll snaps to the next section

If you want a more premium animation (slower + slightly blurred as it leaves), tell me and Ill tune the easing + add a tiny scale/blur transition.

Final clean NavBar (NO blur, NO glass)

import Image from "next/image";
import Link from "next/link";
import { ShimmerButton } from "@/components/ui/shimmer-button";

type Props = {
  hidden?: boolean;
};

export default function NavBar({ hidden = false }: Props) {

          ? "opacity-0 -translate-y-3 pointer-events-none"
          : "opacity-100 translate-y-0",

          <li className="hover:text-white transition">
            <Link href="/collections">COLLECTIONS</Link>
          </li>
          <li className="hover:text-white transition">
            <Link href="/products">PRODUCTS</Link>
          </li>
          <li className="hover:text-white transition">
            <Link href="/about-us">ABOUT US</Link>
          </li>

}

Good catch
This is a layout centering issue, not a video logic issue.

Right now Section 2 content is aligned to the top of the section, so visually it feels too high instead of perfectly centered in the viewport.

Well fix this in a clean, industry-standard way.

Whats wrong (clearly)

In your VideoSliderSection, you have:

tsx
<section className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden">

and inside:

tsx
<div className="relative mx-auto h-[72vh] md:h-[80vh] ...">

So:

  • py-24 pushes content down unevenly

  • the stage is not vertically centered inside the viewport

  • scroll snap lands correctly, but content is top-biased

Correct industry solution

For snap-based sections:

  • The section itself should center its main content

  • Padding should NOT affect vertical centering

  • Use flex centering on the section

FIX 1 Center section content vertically

Replace the opening <section> in VideoSliderSection.tsx

OLD

tsx
<section
  ref={sectionRef}
  className="relative w-full bg-white py-24 md:py-28 overflow-hidden"
>

NEW (THIS IS THE KEY FIX)

tsx
<section
  ref={sectionRef}
  className="relative w-full min-h-dvh bg-white overflow-hidden
             flex items-center justify-center"
>

This ensures everything inside Section 2 is centered vertically in the viewport

FIX 2 Remove vertical padding influence

Inside the section, change this wrapper:

OLD

tsx
<div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-6">

NEW

tsx
<div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl w-full px-6">

(We already centered via flex; padding is now horizontal only.)

FIX 3 Keep the stage perfectly centered

Your stage height is already good, but well slightly refine it.

OLD

tsx
<div className="relative mx-auto h-[72vh] md:h-[80vh] min-h-[460px] max-h-[760px]">

NEW (more balanced)

tsx
<div className="relative mx-auto
                h-[68vh] md:h-[72vh]
                min-h-[460px] max-h-[760px]
                flex items-center justify-center">

This ensures:

  • Stage itself is centered

  • Expansion feels symmetrical

  • Side cards align evenly

Final visual result

After these fixes:

  • Section 2 lands perfectly centered after snap

  • Side previews align correctly

  • Looks like Apple / Netflix / Stripe-level layout polish

Your page.tsx must still look like this:

If min-h-dvh is missing centering will break again.

tsx
"use client";

import React, { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react";
import { Volume2, VolumeX } from "lucide-react";

type VideoItem = {
  id: string;
  src: string;
  poster: string;
  title?: string;
};

type Phase =
  | "idle"
  | "expanding"
  | "playing"
  | "ended"
  | "shrinking"
  | "sliding";

const ENTER_MS = 700;
const SHRINK_MS = 480;
const SLIDE_MS = 460;

function playWhenReady(video: HTMLVideoElement): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    const tryPlay = async () => {
      try {
        video.currentTime = 0;
        await video.play();
      } catch {
        // autoplay might be blocked; mute is default so usually ok
      } finally {
        resolve();
      }
    };

    if (video.readyState >= 3) {
      void tryPlay();
      return;
    }

    const onCanPlay = () => void tryPlay();
    video.addEventListener("canplay", onCanPlay, { once: true });
    video.load();
  });
}

export default function VideoSliderSection() {
  const videos: VideoItem[] = useMemo(
    () => [
      {
        id: "v1",
        src: "/videos/video-1.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-1.jpg",
        title: "Forged Guardian",
      },
      {
        id: "v2",
        src: "/videos/video-2.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-2.jpg",
        title: "Frost Sage",
      },
      {
        id: "v3",
        src: "/videos/video-3.mp4",
        poster: "/video-thumbs/thumb-3.jpg",
        title: "Mystic Unicorn",
      },
    ],
    [],
  );

  const sectionRef = useRef<HTMLElement | null>(null);
  const videoRef = useRef<HTMLVideoElement | null>(null);

  const timersRef = useRef<number[]>([]);
  const clearTimers = () => {
    timersRef.current.forEach((t) => window.clearTimeout(t));
    timersRef.current = [];
  };

  const startedRef = useRef(false);

  const [active, setActive] = useState(0);
  const [phase, setPhase] = useState<Phase>("idle");

  const [stageFull, setStageFull] = useState(false);
  const [slideOffset, setSlideOffset] = useState(0);
  const [muted, setMuted] = useState(true);

  const prevIndex = (active - 1 + videos.length) % videos.length;
  const nextIndex = (active + 1) % videos.length;

  const prev = videos[prevIndex];
  const curr = videos[active];
  const next = videos[nextIndex];

  const pause = () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.pause();
  };

  const start = async () => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;

    v.playsInline = true;
    v.muted = muted;

    setPhase("expanding");
    setStageFull(true);

    clearTimers();
    const t = window.setTimeout(async () => {
      await playWhenReady(v);
      setPhase("playing");
    }, ENTER_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t);
  };

  const onEnded = () => setPhase("ended");

  // Auto-start only once when the section comes into view (first visit)
  useEffect(() => {
    const el = sectionRef.current;
    if (!el) return;

    const obs = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        const inView = entry.isIntersecting && entry.intersectionRatio >= 0.42;
        if (inView && !startedRef.current) {
          startedRef.current = true;
          requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
        }
      },
      { threshold: [0, 0.25, 0.42, 0.6, 1] },
    );

    obs.observe(el);
    return () => {
      obs.disconnect();
      clearTimers();
    };
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.muted = muted;
  }, [muted]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const v = videoRef.current;
    if (!v) return;
    v.load();
  }, [curr.src]);

  const goNext = () => {
    if (phase !== "ended") return;

    pause();

    setPhase("shrinking");
    setStageFull(false);

    clearTimers();
    const t1 = window.setTimeout(() => {
      setPhase("sliding");
      setSlideOffset(-1);

      const t2 = window.setTimeout(() => {
        setActive((x) => (x + 1) % videos.length);
        setSlideOffset(0);
        setPhase("idle");
        requestAnimationFrame(() => void start());
      }, SLIDE_MS);

      timersRef.current.push(t2);
    }, SHRINK_MS);

    timersRef.current.push(t1);
  };

  const showPlayOverlay = phase !== "ended" && phase !== "playing";

  return (
    <section
      ref={sectionRef}
      className="
        relative w-full min-h-dvh bg-white overflow-hidden
        flex items-center justify-center
      "
    >
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl w-full px-6">
        {/* STAGE (centered vertically & horizontally) */}
        <div className="relative mx-auto h-[68vh] md:h-[72vh] min-h-[460px] max-h-[760px] flex items-center justify-center">
          {/* Track (brief slide) */}
          <div
            className={[
              "absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center",
              "transition-transform ease-out will-change-transform transform-gpu",
              phase === "sliding" ? `duration-[${SLIDE_MS}ms]` : "duration-0",
            ].join(" ")}
            style={{
              transform: `translateX(${slideOffset * 240}px)`,
            }}
          >
            {/* LEFT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -mr-28 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={prev.poster} />
            </div>

            {/* CENTER */}
            <div className="z-20 relative">
              {/* Mute/Unmute (NO blur now) */}
              <div className="absolute right-4 top-4 z-30">
                <button
                  onClick={() => setMuted((m) => !m)}
                  className="rounded-full px-3.5 py-2 bg-black/35 text-white hover:bg-black/50 transition flex items-center gap-2 shadow-[0_10px_25px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)]"
                  aria-label={muted ? "Unmute" : "Mute"}
                >
                  {muted ? (
                    <VolumeX className="h-5 w-5" />
                  ) : (
                    <Volume2 className="h-5 w-5" />
                  )}
                  <span className="text-sm">{muted ? "Muted" : "Sound"}</span>
                </button>
              </div>

              {/* Main card */}
              <div
                className={[
                  "relative overflow-hidden rounded-[36px]",
                  "shadow-[0_32px_110px_rgba(0,0,0,0.22)]",
                  "will-change-transform transform-gpu",
                  "transition-transform ease-[cubic-bezier(.2,.8,.2,1)]",
                  stageFull
                    ? `duration-[${ENTER_MS}ms] scale-[1.18]`
                    : `duration-[${SHRINK_MS}ms] scale-100`,
                  "w-[90vw] max-w-[920px] h-[330px] md:w-[920px] md:h-[500px]",
                ].join(" ")}
              >
                <video
                  ref={videoRef}
                  key={curr.id}
                  src={curr.src}
                  poster={curr.poster}
                  preload="auto"
                  playsInline
                  muted={muted}
                  controls={false}
                  onEnded={onEnded}
                  className="absolute inset-0 h-full w-full object-cover"
                />

                <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-gradient-to-t from-black/40 via-black/0 to-black/0" />

                <div className="absolute left-6 bottom-5 text-white z-20">
                  <p className="text-sm opacity-75">Now playing</p>
                  <p className="text-lg font-semibold">{curr.title ?? "Video"}</p>
                </div>

                {showPlayOverlay && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center pointer-events-none z-10">
                    <PlayIcon />
                  </div>
                )}

                {phase === "ended" && (
                  <div className="absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center z-30">
                    <button
                      onClick={goNext}
                      className="rounded-full px-7 py-3 bg-white/90 text-black font-medium shadow-[0_14px_40px_rgba(0,0,0,0.28)] hover:bg-white transition"
                    >
                      Next 
                    </button>
                  </div>
                )}
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* RIGHT preview */}
            <div className="hidden md:block -ml-28 z-10">
              <PreviewCard poster={next.poster} />
            </div>
          </div>

          <div className="pointer-events-none absolute left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 bottom-[-22px] w-[70%] h-14 blur-2xl bg-black/20 rounded-full" />
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}

function PreviewCard({ poster }: { poster: string }) {
  return (
    <div className="w-[360px] h-[320px] rounded-[36px] overflow-hidden shadow-[0_22px_80px_rgba(0,0,0,0.16)] opacity-95">
      <div
        className="h-full w-full bg-cover bg-center"
        style={{ backgroundImage: `url(${poster})` }}
      >
        <div className="h-full w-full bg-black/12 flex items-center justify-center">
          <PlayIcon small />
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

function PlayIcon({ small }: { small?: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div
      className={[
        "rounded-full flex items-center justify-center",
        "shadow-[0_18px_50px_rgba(0,0,0,0.25)]",
        small ? "h-14 w-14 bg-white/14" : "h-20 w-20 bg-white/18",
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <div
        className={
          small
            ? "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[11px] border-b-[11px] border-l-[18px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/55"
            : "ml-1 w-0 h-0 border-t-[14px] border-b-[14px] border-l-[22px] border-t-transparent border-b-transparent border-l-white/70"
        }
      />
    </div>
  );
}
